column4: how would i go about setting Sun Java Runtimes as the default, rather than the OpenJDK Runtimes?
use the "alternatives" method
!alternatives | jedimind
thanks i'll give it a shot
if you prefer gui - install "galternatives"
okay, i went through it, and i changed the java default to sun (i saw it in the list) but when i do java -version ; i still get openSDK
err OpenJDK
which java should return /usr/bin/java, which in turn is actually a link to /etc/alternatives/java
The "java" in /etc/alternatives is set by the update-alternatives command to the java of your choice
at least, it should be. So you could check "which java" and "ls -al /etc/alternatives/java"
well it does return /usr/bin/java but it doesnt seem to be using it when im running ... ANT in this case
should i restart my gnome session?
though...
ok, I'm not sure if ANT has a config, where (fr example) JAVA_HOME is set... I guess that'll override system defaults
doing ls /etc/alternatives/java returns  /etc/alternatives/java -> /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk/jre/bin/java
but which java returns /usr/bin/java
/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk/jre/bin/java
crap
/usr/bin/java is link to /etc/alternatives/java, so it seems, that you update-alternatives have not changed the actual java version?
yeah it doesnt seem like it actually changed it even though i specifically selected it...
also check if the update worked "update-alternatives --list java"
can i msg you for a min?
sure
